section_heading: Building sufficient, secure, and sustainable infrastructure
action_requested: Establish ‘AI Growth Zones’ (AIGZ) to facilitate the accelerated build out of AI data centres.
government_response: Agree. The government will deliver the first AI Growth Zone at Culham, the headquarters of the UK Atomic Energy Authority (UKAEA), subject to the agreement of a public-private partnership that delivers benefits to the local area, the UKAEA's fusion energy mission and the UK's wider national AI infrastructure. By Spring 2025, the government will set out a process to identify and select further AI Growth Zones. This process will take into account how AI Growth Zones can support regional growth opportunities, including those identified in Local Growth Plans and align with the Industrial Strategy's Digital and Technologies Sector, and will consider energy requirements, working with the National Energy System Operator.

section_heading: Advancing AI
action_requested: Create a new unit, with the power to partner with the private sector to deliver the clear mandate of maximising the UK’s stake in frontier AI.
government_response: Agree. The government will create a new function which will draw on wider government functions to partner with AI companies, including by: • Leveraging AI Growth Zones to support partnered companies and ensuring that new compute capacity is utilised strategically. • Exploring making available high-potential data sets for partnered companies, in coordination with the National Data Library. • Supporting top AI talent to relocate to the UK to work with UK-based partnered companies. • Helping to build relationships between partnered AI companies and the UK’s national security community. section_heading: Lay the foundations to enable AI - Building sufficient, secure, and sustainable AI infrastructure
action_requested: Support clean and renewable energy solutions to meet the increasing energy demands of AI.
government_response: The Science and Technology Secretary of State and the Energy Secretary will co-chair a new AI Energy Council of industry leaders from the energy and AI sectors to advise on AI's energy needs and opportunities to accelerate investment in renewable and innovative energy solutions, including Small Modular Reactors, and on the role of AI in a modern, efficient and sustainable energy system.

ai_action_plan_reference.section: 1.1 Building sufficient, secure and sustainable AI infrastructure
ai_action_plan_reference.description: Ensure AI infrastructure is sustainable and supported by adequate clean energy.

section_heading: Next steps
action_requested: Track delivery of the AI Opportunities Action Plan across government.
government_response: The Technology Secretary of State has created an AI Opportunities Unit in DSIT which will report to him regularly on progress across government in delivering the AI Opportunities Action Plan.
delivery_timeline: Ongoing from creation prior to publication of the Government Response

ai_action_plan_reference.section: Whole-of-government implementation of the AI Opportunities Action Plan
ai_action_plan_reference.description: Provide central oversight and coordination of progress against the Action Plan.

section_heading: Change lives by embracing AI
action_requested: Adopt a Scan–Pilot–Scale approach to AI adoption across public services and prioritise scaling successful pilots that adopt AI in the public interest.
government_response: The government intends to accept Matt Clifford's recommendations on AI adoption in full and will start by prioritising the scaling up of successful pilots that adopt AI in the public interest, such as the Caddy project led by the Incubator for AI.

ai_action_plan_reference.section: 2.2 Adopt a "Scan → Pilot → Scale" approach in government
ai_action_plan_reference.description: Embed a systematic Scan–Pilot–Scale model for AI adoption in government services.

section_heading: Secure our future with homegrown AI
action_requested: Strengthen the UK's sovereign AI capabilities by supporting national champions at the frontier of AI.
government_response: The government will launch a new function with the mandate to strengthen the UK's sovereign AI capabilities by supporting national champions at the frontier of AI, partnering with AI companies to leverage AI Growth Zones, make high-potential data sets available, support top AI talent to relocate to the UK and build relationships between partnered AI companies and the UK's national security community, with further details to be provided by Spring 2025.
